before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd615","text":"Consult with your local animal ethics board prior to experimentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3l3nf","text":"Electroporation is an increasingly common technique used for exogenous gene expression in live animals, but protocols are largely limited to traditional laboratory organisms. The goal of this protocol is to enable in vivo electroporation techniques in a diverse array of tadpole species. We explore electroporation efficiency in tissue-specific cells of five species from across three families of tropical frogs—poison frogs (Dendrobatidae), forest frogs (Aromobatidae), and glassfrogs (Centrolenidae). These species are well-known for their diverse social behaviors and intriguing physiologies that coordinate chemical defenses, aposematism, and/or transparency. Specifically, we examine the effects of electrical pulse and injection parameters on species- and tissue-specific transfection of plasmid DNA in tadpoles. After electroporation of a plasmid encoding green fluorescent protein (GFP), we found strong GFP fluorescence within brain and muscle cells that increases with the amount of DNA injected and electrical pulse number. We discuss species-related challenges, troubleshooting, and outline ideas for improvement. Extending in vivo electroporation to diverse amphibian species will offer a powerful approach to explore topics in genetics, behavior, and organismal biology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: Delia et al electroporation how to.mp4

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"etc1u","text":"These parameters are a suggested starting point. Optimizing the protocol for species-specific applications to maximize transfection efficiency is recommended. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ats7d","text":"Mix 0.02g ethyl 3-aminobenzoate methanesulfonate (MS-222) and 0.08g sodium bicarbonate with 60 mL tadpole water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ba885","text":"Store at 4C for up to one week","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b33qe","text":"Remove the tips from two 5 mL serological pipettes using scissors","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2koj","text":"Solder two ~ 5 mm X 8 mm pieces of platinum foil to separate electrical lead wires to make an electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bih1l","text":"Run one electrode wire through each cut serological pipette and secure it with electrical tape","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pabj","text":"Embed the anode into the clay with the foil exposed near the center of the Petri dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb7a2","text":"Set the stimulator parameters to square wave, 1 pps, 0.1 ms delay, 5 ms duration, and 30-50 V","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c94b","text":"Construct a platform out of clay molded into the shape of a hill  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v38s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bh8ii","text":"Fix the clay on the top of a Petri dish ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"830kh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cclkl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2E0DB400607A11ED806F27381D0AF17F","height":412,"id":393002,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5rir6\",\"text\":\"Figure 3. A clay platform molded into the shape of a hill to hold tadpoles during the electroporation procedure. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_1727.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93nbznaf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93kbznaf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93mbznaf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93jbznaf.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7poav","text":"Remove the tips from two 1 mL serological pipettes using scissors","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11g1","text":"Mount the serological pipettes side by side on the micromanipulator and fasten them together with electrical tape ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cas1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fdvr","text":"Run one needle electrode wire through each cut serological pipette ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ncge","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0bdt","text":"Position the electrode needles ~ 1 mm apart and parallel to one another","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i6i4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hl2t","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F4D74FC0608D11ED806F27381D0AF17F","height":733,"id":393006,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2ju50\",\"text\":\"Figure 4. An assembled electrode mounted on a micromanipulator. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_1732.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93sbznaf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93qbznaf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93rbznaf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93pbznaf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kc3d","text":"Set the stimulator parameters to 10 pps, 0.1 ms delay, 15 ms duration, and 30 V","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g9no","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"68acn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"atoq2","text":"These settings are a suggested starting point. Optimizing these parameters for each species, as the best pulse shape and settings may vary, is recommended. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1jp5m","text":"Pull glass capillaries using a pipette puller","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agd66","text":"Break the pipette tip at an angle using forceps to create a beveled tip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tr89","text":"Backfill the pipette with mineral oil using a 28-gauge needle and 1 mL syringe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b7sdl","text":"Place the pipette onto the injector plunger and tighten the collet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ad9k","text":"Select an injection volume of 64.4 nl and set the injection rate to slow","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rji","text":"Empty enough mineral oil to load 2 uL of plasmid DNA solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9eau","text":"Pipette 2 uL of plasmid DNA solution (0.25–0.27μg/μl) onto a piece of parafilm and mix with 0.2 uL 0.01% Fast Green","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"o3ku","text":"Fill the pipette without introducing air bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"foso5","text":"Connect the electrode wires to the stimulator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"619nn","text":"Place the platform under a dissection microscope with the electrode on one side and the injector on the other","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lup6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmr9j","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9hros","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E7451870608711ED806F27381D0AF17F","height":412,"id":393010,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"15l4i\",\"text\":\"Figure 5. A dissection microscope focused on a tadpole injection platform that is placed between an electrode mounted on a micromanipulator and a microinjector mounted on a micromanipulator. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_1728.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93wbznaf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93ubznaf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93vbznaf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93tbznaf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5k7c0","text":"Anesthetize the tadpole by placing it in a Petri dish of room temperature 0.03% MS-222 for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2urmo","text":"Confirm the tadpole is fully sedated by checking for movement in response to stimuli","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d254d","text":"Move the tadpole to the platform with a cut transfer pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6pv1u","text":"Adjust the position of the tadpole using a paintbrush","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9b3cu","text":"For experiments targeting muscle fibers, place the tadpole flat on its side with its head in the depression and its tail on top of the anode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5k5a7","text":"For experiments targeting brain cells, place the tadpole dorsal side up with its head in the depression","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"428tb","text":"Orient the platform such that the head of the tadpole is facing toward the injector","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"24s6n","text":"Lower the injector and insert the pipette into the target tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3crd4","text":"For experiments targeting muscle fibers, insert the pipette into a tail myomere","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh47i","text":"For experiments targeting brain cells, insert the pipette into the brain ventricle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8djk","text":"Inject the plasmid DNA with a 5-10 s interval between each injection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a6de3","text":"For experiments targeting muscle fibers, deliver two injections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bqktk","text":"For experiments targeting brain cells, deliver three injections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5etdt","text":"Remove the pipette from the tadpole","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9grmn","text":"Orient the platform such that the head of the tadpole is facing toward the electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvr1v","text":"Lower the electrode until it is in full contact with the target tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8dtvh","text":"For experiments targeting muscle fibers, the tail should lay on top of the anode and the cathode should press on the tail directly above the anode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jb0f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aefkq","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vpe9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"13CC0080F75911ED86E78141AA0EE3D2","height":330,"id":393014,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"fja15\",\"text\":\"Figure 6. Muscle electroporation in the tail of a Ranitomeya imitator tadpole.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":50,\"length\":19}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"muscle_electroporation.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m932btyax.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93ybtyax.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93zbtyax.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m93xbtyax.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buhst","text":"For experiments targeting brain cells, the electrode should be touching the head on either side of the brain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baipc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hm7q","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"045DF520607511ED806F27381D0AF17F","height":554,"id":393018,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"aua2q\",\"text\":\"Figure 7. Brain electroporation in a Ranitomeya imitator tadpole with the electrode making contact with either side of the brain. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":37,\"length\":19}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2022-11-09 at 1.09.23 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m936bznaf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m934bznaf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m935bznaf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m933bznaf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30ulj","text":"Deliver the electrical pulses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70dmj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tf9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"qsms","text":"The pulse range for targeting brain cells is a suggested starting point. Optimizing the protocol for species-specific applications to maximize transfection efficiency is recommended. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5njkn","text":"For experiments targeting muscle fibers, deliver 4-8 double pulses with a 1 s interval between each set of pulses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73lsq","text":"For experiments targeting brain cells, deliver 4-10 pulses with a 1 s interval between each pulse","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gtnp","text":"Anesthetize the tadpole by placing it in a Petri dish of room temperature 0.03% MS-222 for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d3oh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"comjo","text":"Transfer the tadpole to fresh tadpole water for several hours to recover","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mi8d","text":"Move the tadpole to a new Petri dish with tadpole water and place under a stereomicroscope with a GFP filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq4iv","text":"Center the imaging field on the target tissue and capture the fluorescent image","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bomr","text":"Transfer the tadpole to fresh tadpole water for several hours to recover","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dgth","text":"Roughly 24 to 48 hours after electroporation, screen tadpoles for plasmid uptake by imaging GFP-positive cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eddgd","text":"Construct a platform out of clay evenly spread over the top of a Petri dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbjda","text":"Create a tadpole-sized (~ 1 cm) impression adjacent the anode foil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9va","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv9sj","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CA5D4E0607A11ED806F27381D0AF17F","height":412,"id":393022,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"44rt4\",\"text\":\"Figure 1.
